page.title: 15INDUSTRY IN THE AREA (part1)
page.content: The original industry in the area was farming.With the Industrial Revolution cottage industries such as spinning and weaving were developing into the main industry of the area.Weaving and spinning mills were built close to the R.Calder.Local drift and deep mines were developed and supplied the fuel. The transport system in the valley was improved by the construction of road, rail and canal links to nearby towns. This transport network was used to bring in the raw materials and to take out the finished products.An allied engineering industry also developed making and repairing textile machines. Half a dozen mills were built in our block of land and employed many people in spinning and weaving wool.One spinning mill produced cotton thread. Only three mills are still engaged in textile production
